note.p: Surgeon. Studied at King’s College, London, and St George’s Hospital, London. Assistant surgeon, King’s College Hospital, 1847. Surgeon, Lock Hospital. Transferred to St George’s, 1861; surgeon, 1863–78. FRCS 1844. Member of the council of the Royal College of Surgeons, 1870–8. Specialist in syphilis. Author of Diseases of the veins, haemorrhoidal tumours, and other affections of the rectum (2d ed. 1846) and Lectures on syphilis (1875).
